Class Juego

java.lang.Object
com.example.fpoe_50zo.model.game.Juego
All Implemented Interfaces:
IJuego
public class Juego extends Object implements IJuego
Represents the main "Cincuentazo" game engine. This class manages the game state, players, deck, and enforces all game rules. This is the core of the "Model" in the MVC architecture.

      public Juego()
      Constructs a new game instance. Initializes the deck and player lists.

  • Method Details

    • iniciarJuego

      public void iniciarJuego(int numMaquinas)
      Sets up and starts the game. Creates players, deals initial hands, and places the first card on the table.
      Specified by:
      iniciarJuego in interface IJuego
      Parameters:
      numMaquinas - The number of AI players (1, 2, or 3).

    • jugarCarta

      public void jugarCarta(Carta carta)
      Attempts to play a non-Ace card for the current player.
      Specified by:
      jugarCarta in interface IJuego
      Parameters:
      carta - The card the player wants to play.
      Throws:
      JugadaInvalidaException - if the move is not allowed.

    • jugarCartaAs

      public void jugarCartaAs(Carta carta, int valorElegido)
      Attempts to play an Ace card for the current player with a chosen value.
      Specified by:
      jugarCartaAs in interface IJuego
      Parameters:
      carta - The Ace card to play.
      valorElegido - The value chosen by the player (must be 1 or 10).
      Throws:
      JugadaInvalidaException - if the move is not allowed.

    • revisarEstadoJugadorActual

      public boolean revisarEstadoJugadorActual()
      Checks if the current player has any valid move. If not, the player is eliminated.
      Specified by:
      revisarEstadoJugadorActual in interface IJuego
      Returns:
      true if the player can play, false if they were eliminated.

    • siguienteTurno

      public void siguienteTurno()
      Advances the turn to the next player in the list.

      siguienteTurno in interface IJuego

    • isJuegoTerminado

      public boolean isJuegoTerminado()
      Checks if the game has ended (only one player remains).
      Specified by:
      isJuegoTerminado in interface IJuego
      Returns:
      true if the game is over, false otherwise.
